intro: Parameria pedunculosa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed parameria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in inflorescences at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
